summary:
Amoxicillin is a common antibiotic used to fight bacterial infections like ear infections, sore throats, and pneumonia. It's usually taken by mouth but can also be given as a shot. Side effects might include nausea and rashes. People allergic to penicillin should avoid it.

This medicine has been around since the 1970s and is often given to children. It's very effective and widely available, making it one of the most prescribed antibiotics in the US.
title: Amoxicillin
